meanings.definition: To make a summary or condensed version of something.
meanings.sent1: She synopsized the long book into a short report for her class.
meanings.sent2: I always synopsized the important points before writing my essay.
meanings.sent3: The student synopsized the entire novel in just a few paragraphs, impressing the teacher.
meanings.sent4: His speech was synopsized into a single impactful sentence that everyone remembered.
meanings.sent5: The detective synopsized the case details, focusing on the key evidence.

meanings.definition: A brief summary or condensed version of a text or speech.
meanings.sent1: The professor handed out a synopsized version of the lecture notes.
meanings.sent2: I read the synopsized version of the article to save time.
meanings.sent3: The synopsized playbill made the audience chuckle with its witty descriptions.
meanings.sent4: The brochure was a synopsized guide to the city's main attractions.
meanings.sent5: The student's notebook contained synopsized versions of all the chapters for quick review.
